message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Ghrelin is a hormone secreted by the stomach and stimulates the lateral hypothalamus to increase appetite and promote weight gain. The other options do not have a known role in promoting weight gain or stimulating appetite.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Ghrelin is known to stimulate hunger and increase food intake. The injection of the synthetic analog of an endogenous hormone is likely acting as a ghrelin agonist, leading to increased food intake and weight gain in the experimental group. The other options are not associated with increased food intake or weight gain.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Ghrelin is an endogenous hormone produced by the stomach that stimulates appetite and food intake by activating orexigenic neurons in the hypothalamus. Administration of a synthetic analog of ghrelin to mice would therefore likely lead to increased food intake and weight gain. Cholecystokinin and somatostatin both have satiety-promoting effects, and glucagon primarily affects glucose metabolism and does not have significant effects on appetite or weight gain.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only Ghrelin is known to stimulate the lateral hypothalamus, which plays a role in appetite stimulation and food intake. Increased appetite and weight gain are commonly observed in individuals with high levels of Ghrelin.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The hormone most likely stimulates the lateral hypothalamus, which is the hunger center of the brain. Ghrelin is an endogenous hormone that stimulates hunger and is produced in the stomach. Therefore, it is the most likely option to explain the increased food intake and weight gain in the experimental group.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The question is describing a situation where a synthetic analog of a hormone causes mice to eat more and gain weight. Among the options, only Ghrelin is known to stimulate appetite and promote weight gain. Cholecystokinin reduces appetite, somatostatin inhibits growth hormone release and glucagon increases blood glucose levels.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only Ghrelin is a hormone that stimulates appetite and is produced by the stomach. Injection of a synthetic analog of Ghrelin might lead to increased appetite and weight gain in mice. Cholecystokinin inhibits appetite, so option (A) is incorrect. Somatostatin inhibits the release of growth hormone, but it doesn't have a role in appetite regulation, so option (B) is incorrect. Glucagon stimulates glucose production by the liver and doesn't have a significant effect on appetite regulation, so option (D) is incorrect.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Ghrelin is a hormone produced in the stomach that stimulates appetite and is believed to play a role in obesity. Injecting a synthetic analog of ghrelin would lead to increased appetite and weight gain. Cholecystokinin and somatostatin have opposite effects on appetite, and glucagon does not directly affect appetite.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The hormone-injected mice eat more and gain more weight, which suggests that the hormone stimulates appetite and/or increases metabolism. Among the options, only ghrelin is known to stimulate the lateral hypothalamus, which is involved in appetite regulation. Cholecystokinin, somatostatin, and glucagon are not known to stimulate appetite or increase metabolism.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Ghrelin is a hormone produced by the stomach that stimulates appetite and is known to activate the lateral hypothalamus, the feeding center of the brain. The fact that hormone-injected mice eat more and gain weight suggests that the synthetic analog is acting on ghrelin receptors in the lateral hypothalamus, leading to increased appetite and weight gain. None of the other options are associated with increased appetite and weight gain.
